messages.content: ComfyUI-LNL is designed to enhance video interaction within the ComfyUI framework by enabling users to upload, playback, and perform basic editing on video files directly within the ComfyUI environment.
List the output options from the Load Video Node.
The Load Video Node output options include: Current image, Image Batch (in/out), Frame count (rel), Frame count (abs), Current frame (rel), Current frame (abs), Framerate, and Audio.
What modules are included in the ComfyUI-LNL project?
The module directory of ComfyUI-LNL includes server.py, utils.py, and nodes.py. These modules provide the back-end implementation for video upload, processing, and node specification.

To install ComfyUI-LNL, follow these steps: 1. Ensure ComfyUI and its dependencies are installed. 2. Clone the repository into the custom_nodes directory. 3. Install dependencies if they are not found in the Comfy Manager using `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
What resources are acknowledged in the project credits?
ComfyUI-LNL acknowledges parts of code and ideas from ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts and ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite in its credits. It also uses icons for player controls from Icons8.
What did make this project possible?
The project was made possible through the use of parts of code and some ideas from the ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts, ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite, Icons8, and their respective repositories.
Which language license does ComfyUI-LNL follow?
ComfyUI-LNL is licensed under the GNU General Public License.
